physical_examinations.vital_signs: Heart rate dropped from approximately 60 bpm to approximately 30 bpm; Systolic blood pressure measurements in the 70s to 80s
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Transient episodes of bradycardia and hypotension following second preoperative embolization.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Asystole during surgery; regained pulse and measurable blood pressure after resuscitation
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Severe hemodynamic instability requiring resuscitation during surgery.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Stable vital signs following administration of low-dose dobutamine hydrochloride
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: No signs of cardiac ischemia during ICU monitoring.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement in stability after low-dose dobutamine was administered

physical_examinations.vital_signs: No bradycardia; normal heart rate maintained without pacing
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Resolved cranial nerve deficits postoperatively; pacer wires removed without complication.
